member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.Tools.CannotRemoveControlException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when code tries to remove a host control or Windows Forms control that was added to a document at design time.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.Tools.CannotRemoveCustomizationException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a customization could not be programmatically removed from a document.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.Tools.ControlNameAlreadyExistsException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when you try to add a control to a Microsoft Office Excel workbook or Microsoft Office Word document at run time, but the name provided for the new control already exists in the workbook or document.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.Tools.InvalidRangeException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when you try to add a control to a Microsoft Office Excel workbook at run time, but the specified range contains multiple areas instead of a contiguous block of cells.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.Tools.RangeNotOnWorksheetException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the range provided does not exist on the worksheet.

member.summary: Provides the reason why the data binding failed.

member.summary: The could not be resized to make room for all of the data to be displayed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Tools.Excel.FailureReason.InvalidDataSource
member.summary: The data source specified is not valid.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.Tools.Excel.FailureReason.NoDataBoundColumnsSpecified
member.summary: At least one of the columns specified must map to the .

member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.Tools.Outlook.FormRegionMessageClassAttribute
member.summary: Represents an attribute that specifies the name of a Microsoft Office Outlook message class to associate with the form region.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The name of a message class.
member.exception: The argument is null or is empty.
The argument is greater than 255 characters in length.
The argument is invalid. For more information about valid message class names, see Associating a Form Region with an Outlook Message Class.
